match.title: 1st ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 8 wickets (with 32 balls remaining) (D/L method)

ground.name: Mahinda Rajapaksa International Cricket Stadium, Sooriyawewa, Hambantota
ground.longName: Mahinda Rajapaksa International Cricket Stadium, Sooriyawewa, Hambantota

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Chandimal/†Sangakkara) 112 (136b 10x4 1x6 194m) SR: 82.35

dismissalComment.html: flatter delivery on the pads, the batsman flicks it to short fine leg and the batsmen call for a single, but the throw comes in nice and flat and Tamim is struggling at the striker's end. He is short by a mile. That is the end of a very good innings by Tamim.

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain not out 73 (59b 6x4 3x6 98m) SR: 123.72

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: why play a shot like that! Angelo bowls a full length delivery honing in on the middle stump, and Mush goes for a heave and misses it. He was defending solidly and that shot was completely uncalled for as the run-rate has been good. Hits him right in front and an easy decision for the umpire
edged and gone! It's a length delivery just outside off, nothing much in it and the batsman pushes at it without getting anywhere close to the line, simple edge to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at point! short delivery outside off, Gazi goes for a cut but the ball gets too big on him, he ends up just fending it to Dilshan at point
finally Malinga gets his yorker on target and it hits the base of off stump, no chance for the batsman.

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque b NLTC Perera 13 (20b 1x4 0x6 36m) SR: 65

dismissalComment.html: oh no! He stays on the back foot to a length delivery and pays the price as the ball comes in a touch, but more importantly, stays low. It takes the inside edge and splays the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Ashraful c MDKJ Perera b Kulasekara 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: brilliantly caught at mid-off! It was a length delivery on off stump and Ashraful tries to drive it on the up, but the ball stopped on him a bit and he ended up chipping it towards mid-off where Kushal Perera runs and dives forward to scoop it just before it hits the turf. Very well taken, the umpires check if the catch was clean, and clean it is.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim lbw b Mathews 3 (12b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: why play a shot like that! Angelo bowls a full length delivery honing in on the middle stump, and Mush goes for a heave and misses it. He was defending solidly and that shot was completely uncalled for as the run-rate has been good. Hits him right in front and an easy decision for the umpire

dismissalComment.html: edged and gone! It's a length delivery just outside off, nothing much in it and the batsman pushes at it without getting anywhere close to the line, simple edge to the keeper

dismissalText.commentary: Ziaur Rahman b Senanayake 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: sad end for the debutant as he is unable to get bat on the ball. It was a quicker one on the off stump, the batsman played for the turn off the back foot and played inside the line, then he hears the painful music of leather beating wood. Unlucky for the newbie

dismissalComment.html: finally Malinga gets his yorker on target and it hits the base of off stump, no chance for the batsman.

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan not out 113 (108b 11x4 0x6 160m) SR: 104.62

dismissalText.long: c Ziaur Rahman b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Ziaur Rahman b Rubel Hossain 63 (68b 6x4 0x6 101m) SR: 92.64

dismissalComment.html: caught at third-man! Sanga goes while playing an upper cut, he times it too well and straight into the hands of Ziaur. He falls on the doorstep of a win

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at first slip! Kushal's cameo has been cut short by a good delivery. The batsman comes down the pitch, but the ball dips on him and then turns a bit, takes a healthy outside edge straight into the hands of first slip
caught at third-man! Sanga goes while playing an upper cut, he times it too well and straight into the hands of Ziaur. He falls on the doorstep of a win

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: flatter and shorter outside off, Chandimal goes back and slaps it through cover and runs three

commentPostTextItems.html: Well I hope you all enjoyed the cricket today despite the breaks in between. I certainly did. Mohammad Isam's report will be ready soon and there be more analysis later. This is dreary-eyed Devashish Fuloria signing off. Good night
The biggest Google+ Hangout in cricket's history is happening on Monday, 2:30 PM IST (9:00 AM GMT). Get ready to spend A Day with Dravid.

Angelo Mathews: "We were a bit complacent on the field and a bit wayward with the ball, but we covered it up with our batting. Kushal is absolute pleasure to watch, he has no fear and is a player to watch in the future. We have a young team but we need to persist with the current team. Bangladesh batted brilliantly"

Mushfiqur Rahim: "We played half of the game really well, but we didn't bowl well in the right channel. We scored very well on a pitch that was not easy earlier, but didn't bowl well. Unfortunately, Tamim is out, but we will be ready for the next game."

Dilshan is the Man of the Match: "The ball was coming on really well on to the bat. The first eight overs, we had a great start and we capitalised on that. Young Kushal played a good hand. I have sorted some technical issues in the past few months and it is helping me now."
Nasir Hossain gets an award for hitting three sixes, Tamim Iqbal gets a smartphone for being the smart player of the match, Dilshan gets one award for fastest USB-drive fifty...

Sri Lanka take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series with a very easy win set up by an exhilarating opening stand between Dilshan and Kushal Perera. Dilshan went on to complete his century and was well supported by Sanga, who scored yet another fifty. Bangladesh never appeared to have any control over the batsmen. They also have to now contend with the bad news of losing Tamim Iqbal, who is out of the series. Tamim was the main batsman today and his injury is a serious loss to Bangladesh's chances in the series.

Saimon: "What's the point of selecting genuine bowlers when your allrounders are way better than them? I say, from now on, drop the pacers and play 3 pace bowling allrouders in each game, alongside the two spinners. The idea of 9 effective batsmen doesn't sound bad either."
Karnain: "One Sangakkara or Dilshan should be rested for the next 2 matches. Having said that Sanga needs just 22 to reach 11000 runs in ODIs."
Zara: "Tamim - 112, Dilshan - 113 THAT'S the reason we won :D"

commentPreTextItems.html: And he doesn't release the ball again, takes the towel from the umpire and wipes it..

commentTextItems.html: full and flighted delivery on the middle, pushed to cover

commentPreTextItems.html: Gazi comes round the wicket, a slip in place. He stops twice in his run-up, because the ball is too wet.

commentTextItems.html: tossed up delivery on the leg stump, Chandimal pushes it to midwicket
flighted delivery on off, the batsman pushes it to long-on for a single

dismissalText.long: c Ziaur Rahman b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Ziaur Rahman b Rubel Hossain 63 (68b 6x4 0x6 101m) SR: 92.64

commentTextItems.html: caught at third-man! Sanga goes while playing an upper cut, he times it too well and straight into the hands of Ziaur. He falls on the doorstep of a win

image.longCaption: Ziaur Rahman portrait, World Twenty20, September 14, 2012

headshotImage.caption: Zaiur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: a strange shot by Dilshan. It was a short delivery wide outside off, the batsman was shaping for a pull, then decided to pull-out, but he was too late. The ball hits the bat and goes to third-man

commentPreTextItems.html: jackthelad: "Bit pessimistic, Nazz - look at your bowlers, only four games between them; there's nothing wrong that a little experience won't fix."

commentTextItems.html: short ball, comes in a bit quickly and messes with Dilshan's timing as he goes for the pull, it goes towards midwicket
and another one, this time it goes along the ground and through his favourite extra-cover area, the fielder slides and keeps the ball inside the field.
fuller delivery outside off, Sanga goes down on his knee and drives it over mid-off, it bounces a couple of times before getting to the boundary
full delivery on the pads, the batsman misses his flicks and it hits the pads on its way to short fine-leg fielder
slower delivery on off, pushed firmly off the front foot to mid-off

image.caption: Ziaur Rahman portrait
image.longCaption: Ziaur Rahman portrait, World Twenty20, September 14, 2012

headshotImage.caption: Zaiur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: slightly short of length outside off, the batsman punches it to deep point off the back foot

commentPreTextItems.html: Nazz: "Since Tamim is out, Just take nasir and mushfiqur out of the team, this team will get tough time against Canada"

commentTextItems.html: fuller length delivery on the pads, it flicks the pads on its way to short fine leg
full delivery on off, the batsman drills it to long-off
slower delivery, back of length on the pads, he works it to deep backward square leg for a couple

commentPreTextItems.html: The impressive Ziaur Rahman comes back into the attack

commentTextItems.html: comes down the track and goes for a wild swing, completely misses that one
length delivery on off stump, Sanga drives it back to the bowler
oh nicely played, it was just a good delivery on off and the batsman goes back and steers it to the boundary at deep backward point

commentPostTextItems.html: Kartik: "And Bangladesh's chance of performing well in this ODI series have just slipped down 20%"

commentTextItems.html: short delivery with not much bounce, he swivels and spanks it to deep midwicket
back of length delivery just outside off, pushed to point off the front foot

headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Ziaur Rahman portrait
image.longCaption: Ziaur Rahman portrait, World Twenty20, September 14, 2012

headshotImage.caption: Zaiur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ziaur Rahman b Senanayake 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: sad end for the debutant as he is unable to get bat on the ball. It was a quicker one on the off stump, the batsman played for the turn off the back foot and played inside the line, then he hears the painful music of leather beating wood. Unlucky for the newbie

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sohag Gazi c Dilshan b Malinga 6 (6b 1x4 0x6 6m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: caught at point! short delivery outside off, Gazi goes for a cut but the ball gets too big on him, he ends up just fending it to Dilshan at point

dismissalText.commentary: Abul Hasan b Malinga 3 (6b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: finally Malinga gets his yorker on target and it hits the base of off stump, no chance for the batsman.

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Sohag Gazi
dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Nasir Hossain b Sohag Gazi 42 (36b 5x4 1x6 53m) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: caught at first slip! Kushal's cameo has been cut short by a good delivery. The batsman comes down the pitch, but the ball dips on him and then turns a bit, takes a healthy outside edge straight into the hands of first slip

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan not out 113 (108b 11x4 0x6 160m) SR: 104.62

headshotImage.caption: Zaiur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Ziaur Rahman b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Ziaur Rahman b Rubel Hossain 63 (68b 6x4 0x6 101m) SR: 92.64

dismissalComment.html: caught at third-man! Sanga goes while playing an upper cut, he times it too well and straight into the hands of Ziaur. He falls on the doorstep of a win

milestones.description: Sangakkara has scored 85 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for SL breaking Jayasuriya's record
Tamim Iqbal has scored 28 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Shakib's record

stories.title: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 2012-13
stories.subTitle: 1st ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh: Wisden Almanack review
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the first ODI, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 2012-13

stories.title: The return of the rampaging Sri Lankan openers
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: The return of the rampaging Sri Lankan openers
stories.summary: For Sri Lanka, the blazing opening stand between Tillakaratne Dilshan and Kushal Janith Perera in Hambantota was a welcome throwback to the days of Jayasuriya and Kaluwitharana

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan and Kusal Perera shared a 106-run opening stand
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan and Kusal Perera shared a 106-run opening stand, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota, March 23, 2013

stories.title: Tamim ends century drought
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota
stories.summary: Tamim Iqbal, the Bangladesh batsman, has said the biggest inspiration for his century was his Test opening partner, Jahurul Islam

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal is jubilant after scoring his fourth ODI hundred
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal is jubilant after scoring his fourth ODI hundred, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota, March 23, 2013

stories.title: An unusual pitch invasion
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota
stories.summary: Plays of the day from the first ODI between Sri Lanka and Bangladesh in Hambantota

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan gestures to Bangladesh batsmen who take evasive action from an insect attack
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan gestures to Bangladesh batsmen who take evasive action from an insect attack, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota, March 23, 2013

stories.title: Injured Tamim out of remaining ODIs
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: Injured Tamim Iqbal out of remaining ODIs
stories.summary: Tamim Iqbal, the Bangladesh batsman, has been ruled out of the rest of the ODI series against Sri Lanka due to a hairline fracture on his right thumb

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal suffered a hairline fracture on his right thumb while fielding
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal suffered a hairline fracture on his right thumb while fielding, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota, March 23, 2013

stories.title: SLC apologises for floodlight failure
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota
stories.summary: Sri Lanka Cricket has apologised for the generator failures that halted play for 99 minutes in the first ODI in Hambantota, and said an investigation into the problem will be launched tomorrow

image.caption: Nasir Hossain acknowledges the crowd after his fifty
image.longCaption: Nasir Hossain acknowledges the crowd after his fifty, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota, March 23, 2013

stories.title: Dilshan powers Sri Lanka towards victory
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: Tillakartane Dilshan powers Sri Lanka towards victory
stories.summary: The 85-minute delay due to a power failure before the start of the chase in Hambantota seemed enough to rev up Sri Lanka, as they raced to 144 for 1 in 20 overs
stories.byline: The Report by Mohammad Isam in Hambantota

image.caption: Kusal Perera blasts one through the off side
image.longCaption: Kusal Perera blasts one through the off side, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota, March 23, 2013

stories.title: Emerging talent will test Sri Lanka's stars
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh in Sri Lanka 2012-13
stories.seoTitle: Emerging talent will test Sri Lanka's stars
stories.summary: Sri Lanka's established performers will be pushed hard by the new crop of domestic players that are looking to get into the team ahead of the Champions Trophy

image.caption: Lahiru Thirimanne is congratulated by Kusal Perera for his century
image.longCaption: Lahiru Thirimanne is congratulated by Kusal Perera for his century, Australia v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Adelaide, January 13, 2013

stories.summary: The preview of the first ODI between Sri Lanka and Bangladesh in Hambantota

image.caption: Dinesh Chandimal tucks a delivery away towards the leg side
image.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal tucks a delivery away towards the leg side, Sri Lanka v New Zealand, 4th ODI, Hambantota, November 10, 2012

stories.title: Sri Lanka need team effort for success in ODIs - Mathews
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka need team effort for success in ODIs - Angelo Mathews
stories.summary: Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews has called for strong collective performance, rather than reliance on key players, as he prepares to lead the team in his first ODI series as captain

image.caption: Angelo Mathews with Dinesh Chandimal at a practise session
image.longCaption: Angelo Mathews with Dinesh Chandimal at a practise session, Colombo, July 27 2012

seriesNextMatches.statusText: Bangladesh won by 3 wickets (with 6 balls remaining) (D/L method)
